trans-unit.source: Install the LAMP stack on a Linux virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Install the LAMP stack on a Linux virtual machine

trans-unit.source: Learn how to install the LAMP stack on a Linux virtual machine (VM) in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to install the LAMP stack on a Linux virtual machine (VM) in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can install on Ubuntu or CentOS.
trans-unit.target: You can install on Ubuntu or CentOS.

trans-unit.source: Install the LAMP Stack on a Linux virtual machine in Azure
trans-unit.target: Install the LAMP Stack on a Linux virtual machine in Azure

trans-unit.source: A LAMP stack consists of the following different elements:
trans-unit.target: A LAMP stack consists of the following different elements:

trans-unit.source: **L**inux - Operating System
trans-unit.target: **L**inux - Operating System

trans-unit.source: **A**pache - Web Server
trans-unit.target: **A**pache - Web Server

trans-unit.source: **M**ySQL - Database Server
trans-unit.target: **M**ySQL - Database Server

trans-unit.source: **P**HP - Programming Language
trans-unit.target: **P**HP - Programming Language

trans-unit.source: Installing on Ubuntu
trans-unit.target: Installing on Ubuntu

trans-unit.source: You will need the following packages installed:
trans-unit.target: You will need the following packages installed:

trans-unit.source: After running `apt-get update` to update the local list of packages, you can then install these packages with a single `apt-get install` command:
trans-unit.target: After running `apt-get update` to update the local list of packages, you can then install these packages with a single `apt-get install` command:

trans-unit.source: After running the above command you will be prompted to install these packages and a number of other dependencies.
trans-unit.target: After running the above command you will be prompted to install these packages and a number of other dependencies.

trans-unit.source: Press 'y' and then 'Enter' to continue, and follow any other prompts to set an administrative password for MySQL.
trans-unit.target: Press 'y' and then 'Enter' to continue, and follow any other prompts to set an administrative password for MySQL.

trans-unit.source: This will install the minimum required PHP extensions needed to use PHP with MySQL.
trans-unit.target: This will install the minimum required PHP extensions needed to use PHP with MySQL.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to see other PHP extensions that are available as packages:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to see other PHP extensions that are available as packages:

trans-unit.source: Installing on CentOS & Oracle Linux
trans-unit.target: Installing on CentOS & Oracle Linux

trans-unit.source: You will need the following packages installed:
trans-unit.target: You will need the following packages installed:

trans-unit.source: You can install these packages with a single `yum install` command:
trans-unit.target: You can install these packages with a single `yum install` command:

trans-unit.source: After running the above command you will be prompted to install these packages and a number of other dependencies.
trans-unit.target: After running the above command you will be prompted to install these packages and a number of other dependencies.

trans-unit.source: Press 'y' and then 'Enter' to continue.
trans-unit.target: Press 'y' and then 'Enter' to continue.

trans-unit.source: This will install the minimum required PHP extensions needed to use PHP with MySQL.
trans-unit.target: This will install the minimum required PHP extensions needed to use PHP with MySQL.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to see other PHP extensions that are available as packages:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to see other PHP extensions that are available as packages:

trans-unit.source: Installing on SUSE Linux Enterprise Server
trans-unit.target: Installing on SUSE Linux Enterprise Server

trans-unit.source: You will need the following packages installed:
trans-unit.target: You will need the following packages installed:

trans-unit.source: apache2
trans-unit.target: apache2

trans-unit.source: mysql
trans-unit.target: mysql

trans-unit.source: apache2-mod_php53
trans-unit.target: apache2-mod_php53

trans-unit.source: php53-mysql
trans-unit.target: php53-mysql

trans-unit.source: You can install these packages with a single `zypper install` command:
trans-unit.target: You can install these packages with a single `zypper install` command:

trans-unit.source: After running the above command you will be prompted to install these packages and a number of other dependencies.
trans-unit.target: After running the above command you will be prompted to install these packages and a number of other dependencies.

trans-unit.source: Press 'y' and then 'Enter' to continue.
trans-unit.target: Press 'y' and then 'Enter' to continue.

trans-unit.source: This will install the minimum required PHP extensions needed to use PHP with MySQL.
trans-unit.target: This will install the minimum required PHP extensions needed to use PHP with MySQL.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to see other PHP extensions that are available as packages:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to see other PHP extensions that are available as packages:

trans-unit.source: Setting Up
trans-unit.target: Setting Up

trans-unit.source: Set up **Apache**
trans-unit.target: Set up **Apache**

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to ensure the Apache web server is started:
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to ensure the Apache web server is started:

trans-unit.source: Ubuntu & SLES: `sudo service apache2 restart`
trans-unit.target: Ubuntu & SLES: `sudo service apache2 restart`

trans-unit.source: CentOS & Oracle: `sudo service httpd restart`
trans-unit.target: CentOS & Oracle: `sudo service httpd restart`

trans-unit.source: Apache listens on port 80 by default.
trans-unit.target: Apache listens on port 80 by default.

trans-unit.source: You may need to open an endpoint to access your Apache server remotely.
trans-unit.target: You may need to open an endpoint to access your Apache server remotely.

trans-unit.source: Please see the documentation on [configuring endpoints](virtual-machines-set-up-endpoints.md) for more detailed instructions.
trans-unit.target: Please see the documentation on [configuring endpoints](virtual-machines-set-up-endpoints.md) for more detailed instructions.

trans-unit.source: You can now check to see that Apache is running and serving content.
trans-unit.target: You can now check to see that Apache is running and serving content.

trans-unit.source: Point your browser to `http://[MYSERVICE].cloudapp.net`, where **[MYSERVICE]** is the name of the cloud service in which your virtual machine resides.
trans-unit.target: Point your browser to `http://[MYSERVICE].cloudapp.net`, where **[MYSERVICE]** is the name of the cloud service in which your virtual machine resides.

trans-unit.source: On some distributions you may be greeted by a default web page that simply states "It works!".
trans-unit.target: On some distributions you may be greeted by a default web page that simply states "It works!".

trans-unit.source: On others you may see a more complete web page with links to additional documentation and content for configuring the Apache server.
trans-unit.target: On others you may see a more complete web page with links to additional documentation and content for configuring the Apache server.

trans-unit.source: Set up **MySQL**
trans-unit.target: Set up **MySQL**

trans-unit.source: Note that this step is not necessary on Ubuntu, which prompts you for a MySQL `root` password when the mysql-server package was installed.
trans-unit.target: Note that this step is not necessary on Ubuntu, which prompts you for a MySQL `root` password when the mysql-server package was installed.

trans-unit.source: On other distributions, set the root password for MySQL by running the following command:
trans-unit.target: On other distributions, set the root password for MySQL by running the following command:

trans-unit.source: You can then manage MySQL using the `mysql` or `mysqladmin` utilities.
trans-unit.target: You can then manage MySQL using the `mysql` or `mysqladmin` utilities.

trans-unit.source: Further Reading
trans-unit.target: Further Reading

trans-unit.source: Suppose you want to automate these steps to deploy applications to remote Linux virtual machines?
trans-unit.target: Suppose you want to automate these steps to deploy applications to remote Linux virtual machines?

trans-unit.source: You can do this using the Linux CustomScript extension.
trans-unit.target: You can do this using the Linux CustomScript extension.

trans-unit.source: See [Deploy a LAMP app using the Azure CustomScript Extension for Linux](virtual-machines-linux-script-lamp.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Deploy a LAMP app using the Azure CustomScript Extension for Linux](virtual-machines-linux-script-lamp.md).

trans-unit.source: There are many other resources for setting up a LAMP stack on Ubuntu.
trans-unit.target: There are many other resources for setting up a LAMP stack on Ubuntu.

trans-unit.source: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/ApacheMySQLPHP
trans-unit.target: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/ApacheMySQLPHP
